alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued November 14 at 2:37PM EST until November 17 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM WEDNESDAY TO 1 PM EST THURSDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM WEDNESDAY TO 1 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves up to 6 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected up to 2.5 feet. * WHERE...Coastal Franklin County. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Thursday night. For the High Surf Advisory, from 1 AM Wednesday to 1 PM EST Thursday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 AM Wednesday to 1 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
